Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Some offer their material wealth, while others offer strict vows of asceticism. Still, others dedicate their study of scriptures and spiritual wisdom as a sacred sacrifice.

Verse: "All actions, whether good or bad, should be offered to the Supreme, and this offers liberation from the bondage of the material world."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even the simplest act, when done with devotion, becomes a sacred offering. Those who act without attachment to rewards attain spiritual wisdom and inner peace.

Verse: "Through self-control and detachment, and by controlling the senses, a person can offer all actions to the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: By controlling their breath and senses, yogis harmonize their physical and mental energies, merging them into the Supreme Consciousness. Such disciplined practice leads to enlightenment.

Verse: "Those who perform the sacrifice of knowledge with devotion attain liberation, for their hearts are purified by the knowledge of the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who understand the true purpose of sacrifice realize the divine nature of all actions. By acting selflessly, they attain freedom from suffering and transcend the material world.

Verse: "Those who are devoted to knowledge and who perform their actions selflessly are freed from sin and attain liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even if one performs the greatest sacrifices, if done without knowledge and devotion, they yield only temporary results. True wisdom is the highest form of sacrifice.

Verse: "Those who surrender all actions to me and who engage in constant devotion to me, are never abandoned by me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: All paths of sacrifice originate from divine wisdom. When performed with understanding, they lead one to liberation and eternal bliss.

Verse: "Even if a person commits a great sin, but is devoted to me, that person can be redeemed by my grace and reach the highest goal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Knowledge is superior to mere rituals, for wisdom directly leads to liberation. A realized soul understands the deeper essence of sacrifice and sees all actions as sacred.

Verse: "Learn from those who are wise and who have mastered the scriptures, inquire from them with respect, and they will teach you the knowledge you seek."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Seek wisdom from the enlightened, approach them with humility, and serve them sincerely. They will guide you to the highest truth through their divine knowledge.

Verse: "Upon learning the truth, you will no longer be deluded, and you will see all beings in their true nature."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Once you gain true wisdom, you will no longer be confused. You will see all beings as part of the Divine and recognize the unity of existence.

Verse: "Even if you are the most sinful of sinners, you can cross over all sins by the raft of knowledge."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even the most sinful person, upon gaining true knowledge, can cross over the ocean of sin and attain liberation, just as fire burns away all impurities.

Verse: "As the blazing fire turns wood to ash, the fire of knowledge consumes all actions and purifies the soul."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Just as a blazing fire reduces wood to ashes, so does the fire of knowledge destroy all past karma, freeing the soul from bondage.

Verse: "There is nothing as purifying as knowledge. One who is perfectly devoted to the path of knowledge realizes the supreme."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: There is no purifier greater than knowledge. A person who sincerely pursues wisdom attains purity and self-realization in due time.

Verse: "A person who has faith, who is devoted, and who has mastered their senses, attains knowledge, and through knowledge, attains liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A person with faith and devotion, who strives with discipline, ultimately attains the highest knowledge and experiences the supreme peace of enlightenment.

Verse: "One who does not have faith in this knowledge, does not attain liberation and remains bound by material desires."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who doubt and lack faith remain trapped in ignorance. Neither in this life nor the next do they attain happiness, for their minds are restless.

Verse: "Those who have renounced action and who are free from attachment, attain peace, and their hearts become illuminated by divine wisdom."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who renounces doubts through wisdom and acts with a pure heart is liberated from karma and attains divine bliss.

Verse: "Therefore, with a focused mind, surrender all your actions to the Supreme, and with a firm determination, perform your duty."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Arjuna, rise and fight with knowledge! Destroy the doubts in your heart through wisdom, take up your duty with courage, and follow the path of righteousness.

Verse: "Those who, while performing their actions, renounce the fruits of action, are considered true renunciates and yogis."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, You praise both renunciation of action and selfless action. Which of these paths is superior? Kindly guide me so that I may choose the best path for my spiritual progress.

Verse: "Renunciation of action, O Arjuna, is difficult to achieve without the knowledge of the self. Therefore, those who know the self call it true renunciation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Both renunciation (Sannyasa) and selfless action (Karma Yoga) lead to liberation, but of the two, Karma Yoga is superior. A true renunciate is one who works without attachment rather than one who merely gives up physical action.

Verse: "The true renunciant is one who, free from attachment, is unaffected by pleasure or pain, and works for the welfare of others."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who neither hates nor desires the fruits of actions is a true renunciate. Free from all dualities, they are easily liberated from the bondage of karma and attain inner peace.

Verse: "Those who do not act for selfish purposes, but who act for the sake of others, remain free from the bondage of actions."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Only the ignorant believe that renunciation and selfless action are separate paths. The wise understand that both lead to the same goal. One who masters Karma Yoga will naturally attain the perfection of renunciation.

Verse: "A person who is detached from the fruits of action, who is without desires, and who is free from egoism, attains liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The state attained by renunciates is also achieved by Karma Yogis. The one who sees no difference between these two paths truly understands the essence of spiritual wisdom.

Verse: "By performing all actions without attachment, the mind becomes purified, and through meditation, one can attain supreme peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: True renunciation is difficult to achieve without selfless action. But the wise one who follows Karma Yoga with devotion quickly reaches the Supreme.

Verse: "One who is not attached to the results of their actions, who remains unaffected by pleasure or pain, is a true yogi."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The selfless worker who is pure in heart, who controls the senses and mind, and who sees all beings as equal, remains unaffected by karma and attains liberation.

Verse: "Such a yogi is free from desires, renounces all attachments, and performs actions as a pure offering to the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A wise person who knows the truth understands, “I do nothing at all.” Even while seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, walking, sleeping, and breathing, they remain free from attachment.

Verse: "One who sees the divine presence in all beings, and sees all beings in the divine, is a true yogi."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The enlightened one, though engaged in all kinds of actions, remains untouched by them, realizing that all actions are carried out by the senses interacting with their objects, not by the true Self.

Verse: "The one who is detached from the external world, who has mastered their senses, and who works with a mind focused on the divine, is free from the bondage of action."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: One who dedicates all actions to the Divine, remaining free from attachment, is unaffected by sin, just as a lotus leaf remains untouched by water.

Verse: "Those who are unattached to the fruits of their actions, and who live without desire, live in harmony with the divine, and reach the highest state of being."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The self-controlled person performs all actions with body, mind, intellect, and senses, without attachment, solely for the purpose of self-purification.

Verse: "By renouncing attachment to the material world, and by controlling the mind and senses, one attains peace and liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who surrenders all actions to God attains eternal peace, while the one who remains attached to results is bound by desires and suffers anxieties.

Verse: "Through the practice of true renunciation and by dedicating all actions to the Supreme, a person reaches the ultimate goal of liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A true renunciate dwells happily in the body without identifying with it. Having given up all attachment to action, they rest in the divine consciousness and remain unshaken.

Verse: "All actions are performed by the three gunas (modes of nature), but the self, free from the influence of these gunas, does not act."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The Supreme does not create people’s actions, nor their sense of duty, nor the results of their deeds. These arise from nature and human tendencies.

Verse: "The ignorant believe that the self performs actions, but those who know the self understand that the self is not the doer."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The Lord does not take responsibility for anyone’s virtues or sins. However, ignorance clouds the understanding of living beings, preventing them from realizing this truth.

Verse: "The wise person, who has realized their true nature, sees all beings equally, unaffected by the external circumstances."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: But those whose ignorance is dispelled by the light of knowledge see the Supreme Reality shining like the sun, illuminating all their actions.

Verse: "Those who are free from attachment and who have overcome desires, attain peace and unity with the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who fix their mind and intellect on the Divine, who remain devoted and absorbed in knowledge, attain liberation and are freed from all past karma.

Verse: "By renouncing the fruits of action, a person attains liberation and is freed from the bondage of the material world."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The wise see all beings with equal vision—whether it be a learned scholar, a humble cow, an elephant, a dog, or even a lowly outcast. This divine vision arises from self-realization.

Verse: "The yogi who remains unattached to worldly desires, and who has mastered their mind, attains supreme peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those whose minds are established in equality have already conquered this world. They are free from illusion and remain in unity with the Supreme, untouched by pleasure or pain.

Verse: "One who has purified their mind through knowledge and devotion, and who performs actions for the welfare of others, is a true renunciant."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who is not elated by success, nor disturbed by sorrow, who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is truly a sage of steady wisdom.

Verse: "By remaining detached from the material world and devoting oneself to the divine, one reaches the ultimate state of liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The self-realized person, detached from external pleasures, finds joy within. By uniting with the Supreme, they experience boundless bliss beyond the temporary joys of the senses.

Verse: "Pleasures that arise from contact with the material world are temporary, and one who seeks lasting happiness turns inward to the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The pleasures of the senses are temporary and sources of suffering. The wise do not seek joy in them, knowing that true happiness lies beyond material enjoyment.

Verse: "By renouncing attachment to the material world, and through meditation, one attains peace, and no longer remains affected by external circumstances."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who, before leaving this body, conquers desires and anger, and remains self-controlled, is a true yogi and finds true happiness.

Verse: "Those who are free from attachment and desires, and who perform actions as an offering to the divine, are never bound by the fruits of their actions."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The self-controlled sage, who is free from inner darkness, whose mind is firmly fixed on the Supreme, experiences the eternal joy of liberation.

Verse: "The true yogi renounces all worldly attachments, and through devotion and surrender to the divine, reaches the highest state of consciousness."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who strive for liberation, whose impurities are cleansed through self-discipline, who work for the welfare of all, attain divine bliss.

Verse: "The one who has renounced desires and who sees the divine presence in all beings, becomes free from the cycle of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who is free from desire and anger, who has conquered the mind and realized the Self, attains supreme peace and the highest state of being.

Verse: "With a pure mind, controlled senses, and a steady focus, the yogi meditates on the divine, attaining supreme peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: By withdrawing the senses from external distractions, focusing the mind between the eyebrows, and regulating the breath, one attains inner peace and divine realization.

Verse: "The one who is detached from worldly pleasures, who remains unaffected by pain or joy, and who constantly meditates on the divine, attains liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: With senses, mind, and intellect under control, the yogi, free from desires and attachments, merges with the Divine and attains liberation.

Verse: "Those who have realized the supreme, know that I am the source of all creation, and they worship me with devotion, attaining eternal peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who takes refuge in Me, knowing Me as the Supreme Lord of all worlds and the friend of all beings, attains eternal peace and freedom from suffering.

Verse: "One who renounces all actions and performs their duties without attachment is a true renunciant, a true yogi."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The true renunciate is not one who merely gives up actions but one who performs duties selflessly without attachment to the results. Such a person is both a renunciate and a yogi.

Verse: "Yoga is the path of self-discipline, where one controls the mind and attains union with the divine. A true yogi is one who works with a disciplined mind."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, know that what is called renunciation is also true Yoga. No one can become a perfect yogi without renouncing the desire for the fruits of actions.

Verse: "A person who has mastered the art of yoga, while living in the world, remains unattached to worldly desires, performing all actions selflessly."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who has just begun the path of Yoga works through action. But the one who has attained perfection in Yoga transcends all material efforts and rests in self-realization.

Verse: "One who has reached the highest state of yoga, and whose mind is free from attachment, sees all beings equally and perceives the divine presence in all."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: When a yogi has given up all desires and attachments, remaining content in the Self alone, they are said to be truly established in Yoga.

Verse: "A yogi must always strive to lift themselves up through their own efforts and should never degrade themselves. The mind is the friend and the enemy of the self."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Let a person uplift themselves by their own efforts, not degrade themselves. The mind alone is both a friend and an enemy of the self.

Verse: "For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is their best friend. But for one who has failed to do so, the mind acts as the enemy."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the greatest friend. But for one who has not mastered the mind, it acts as an enemy, leading to suffering.

Verse: "A yogi who has subdued the mind, with a calm and composed nature, remains unaffected by external circumstances."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The self-controlled person, who is free from dualities and remains equanimous in honor and dishonor, happiness and distress, is firmly established in spiritual wisdom.

Verse: "Such a person sees gold and dirt equally, and treats both with the same regard, remaining unattached and unaffected by worldly desires."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who is satisfied with knowledge and wisdom, who is undisturbed in all situations, and who remains detached from material possessions, is truly a perfected yogi.

Verse: "The yogi who is detached from the material world and is free from desires, attains the highest state of being and experiences supreme peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A true yogi sees all beings with equal vision—whether it is a kind teacher, a friend, a neutral person, an enemy, or even a saint or sinner.

Verse: "A true yogi remains isolated from worldly distractions, and through constant practice, attains inner peace and union with the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A yogi should always remain absorbed in meditation, dwelling in solitude, with a controlled mind, free from desires and possessiveness.

Verse: "The yogi should sit in a clean place, with a focused mind, free from distractions, and practice meditation on the divine, controlling the senses and the mind."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi should sit in a clean, sacred place on a firm seat, neither too high nor too low, covered with a cloth, deerskin, and kusha grass.

Verse: "While meditating, the yogi should remain steady, calm, and composed, controlling all desires and focusing the mind on the divine alone."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Sitting there, the yogi should fix the mind on the Supreme, remain undisturbed, and meditate with a steady mind, free from distractions.

Verse: "By fixing the mind in meditation and sitting in a steady posture, the yogi remains free from distractions, with a single-pointed focus on the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi should keep the body, head, and neck erect, focusing the gaze at the tip of the nose without looking around.

Verse: "With a mind disciplined and free from attachment, the yogi is unaffected by external circumstances and attains the highest level of peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: With a serene mind, free from fear, practicing celibacy, and fixing the thoughts on Me, the yogi attains ultimate peace and liberation.

Verse: "The yogi who is balanced in their actions, and who meditates with full dedication, attains the supreme peace and experiences the presence of the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Thus, by constantly practicing meditation, the yogi attains liberation and reaches My eternal abode.

Verse: "Yoga is not for the one who eats too much or too little, nor for the one who sleeps too much or stays awake too long. The balanced approach is the key."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, one who eats too much or too little, who sleeps too much or too little, cannot succeed in Yoga.

Verse: "The person who has mastered yoga, who controls their senses, and who remains detached from all desires, finds peace and contentment."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The one who is moderate in eating, sleeping, work, and recreation can achieve success in Yoga and remain free from suffering.

Verse: "Through steady practice, the yogi becomes free from distractions, and through meditation, attains a focused, one-pointed mind."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: When the mind is completely withdrawn from material desires and fixed in the Self, the yogi is said to be established in Yoga.

Verse: "When the mind, controlled and free from desires, is absorbed in meditation, the yogi experiences true bliss and union with the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Just as a steady flame does not flicker in a windless place, so too is the yogi’s mind when absorbed in meditation on the Supreme.

Verse: "That which is beyond the mind, beyond the senses, and beyond the material world, is the state of true meditation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi, free from distractions, experiences boundless joy in the realization of the Supreme, beyond the grasp of the senses.

Verse: "The yogi, through meditation, attains a state where they experience an unbroken flow of peace, beyond the material senses."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Having attained divine bliss, the yogi sees no greater gain and is never shaken, even in the midst of suffering.

Verse: "In this state of meditation, the yogi experiences a deep, inner happiness, and all desires are extinguished, replaced by a sense of divine bliss."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The state of self-realization, once attained, is beyond sorrow and suffering. It is the ultimate goal of human existence.

Verse: "One who meditates on the divine with a focused and controlled mind, free from distractions, remains unaffected by joy and sorrow."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, let go of all attachments and distractions. With unwavering determination, focus on self-discipline and meditation.

Verse: "With steady concentration, the yogi should free the mind from all distractions, and thus, remain undisturbed in the state of meditation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A yogi should gradually withdraw the mind from external distractions and fix it steadily on the Self, never thinking of anything else.

Verse: "The yogi, who practices meditation with persistence and self-control, gradually reaches a state of steady, undistracted focus on the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: With patience and determination, the yogi should fix the mind on the Supreme, never allowing it to wander towards material desires.

Verse: "Whenever the mind wanders away from its focus, it should be gently brought back, without judgment, to the divine object of meditation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Whenever the mind strays from the Supreme, gently bring it back under control and focus it on meditation.

Verse: "Through constant and sincere practice, the mind gradually becomes calm, focused, and fully absorbed in the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi whose mind is perfectly tranquil, free from material desires, attains the boundless joy of realization and becomes one with the Divine.

Verse: "By practicing meditation, one attains tranquility, which leads to perfect peace and liberation from the cycle of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: By constant meditation, the self-disciplined yogi attains supreme peace and abides in the eternal bliss of union with the Divine.

Verse: "The yogi, who sees the divine presence in all beings and remains undisturbed by the external world, attains the ultimate state of union with the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi sees the Supreme in all beings and all beings in the Supreme, perceiving the unity of existence.

Verse: "One who is unattached, free from desires, and sees the divine in all beings, has reached the highest level of spiritual realization."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me is never lost to Me, nor am I ever lost to them.

Verse: "Such a yogi experiences union with the divine, remaining unaffected by external circumstances, and attains true happiness and peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi who worships Me in all beings, who perceives the unity of existence, resides in Me and is never separated from Me.

Verse: "The person who practices yoga with devotion, renounces all attachments, and views all beings equally, is the highest of yogis."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, the highest yogi is one who sees all beings as equal, sharing in their joys and sorrows as their own.

Verse: "Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have spoken of the importance of meditation, but my mind is restless and difficult to control. What can I do?"
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, the path of Yoga that You have described appears very difficult because the mind is restless and unsteady.

Verse: "The mind, O Krishna, is restless, turbulent, powerful, and obstinate. I think it is impossible to control it."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: The mind is turbulent, strong, and stubborn. Controlling it seems harder than controlling the wind.

Verse: "Krishna said: Undoubtedly, O Arjuna, the mind is restless and difficult to control, but it can be controlled by practice and detachment."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, without doubt, the mind is difficult to control, but with practice and detachment, it can be mastered.

Verse: "Through persistent effort and self-control, one can overcome the restlessness of the mind, just as the wind is controlled by a skilled archer."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: A yogi with self-discipline can attain realization, but one without control over the mind will struggle, even with great effort.

Verse: "One who is dedicated to the path of yoga, and who strives with determination, can conquer the restless mind, even if it takes time."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, what happens to a seeker who starts on the path of Yoga but fails to reach perfection before death?

Verse: "Even those who make a sincere effort on the path of yoga but do not reach perfection in this life, will be born again in a pious family or a wise family."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: Does such a person perish like a broken cloud, lost between the material and spiritual worlds? Please clear my doubt.

Verse: "By continuing the practice in their next life, they will attain perfection, for the wisdom they accumulated in their past life will guide them."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, a person who sincerely strives for Yoga never meets destruction, either in this life or the next.

Verse: "Those who have made efforts towards spiritual practice and who do not succeed, will never be lost. They are carried forward into the next life."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: One who falls short in Yoga is reborn in a family of righteous people or spiritual seekers, where they resume their practice.

Verse: "The person who has made a genuine effort in yoga, even if they fall short of the ultimate goal, will be led to the path of liberation in the next life."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Such a soul, blessed by past merits, is naturally drawn towards Yoga and continues on the path of self-realization.

Verse: "Arjuna, the yogi who strives with devotion, and who has been blessed by divine grace, is never abandoned and ultimately attains the highest goal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Through dedicated effort in future lives, they rise above all obstacles and attain liberation.

Verse: "Such a yogi, who has reached the highest state, will unite with me and attain eternal peace."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The yogi surpasses those who practice mere austerities, scriptural study, or ritual worship. Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi!

Verse: "The yogi, who constantly meditates and remains dedicated to the path of self-realization, will eventually achieve union with the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among all yogis, the one who surrenders fully to Me, worshiping Me with love and devotion, is the highest of all.

Verse: "By performing selfless actions, detaching from the material world, and seeking divine union, the yogi attains the ultimate goal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The greatest yogi is one whose mind is fixed on Me, who serves Me with unwavering faith and devotion.

Verse: "Of all yogis, the one who worships the divine with a pure heart and who meditates on the divine is considered the highest."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Such a yogi transcends all material existence and attains the eternal abode of peace and bliss.

Verse: "Therefore, O Arjuna, among all yogis, the one who is dedicated to me, with unwavering devotion and pure heart, is the most superior."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Therefore, O Arjuna, among all spiritual seekers, the one who worships Me with supreme love and devotion is the most exalted of all.

Verse: "Now hear, O son of Kunti, how by practicing yoga with a steadfast mind, you can know Me in full, with all My mystery."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, listen attentively as I reveal the supreme knowledge that, once known, nothing more remains to be learned in this world.

Verse: "I shall now declare to you in full this knowledge and wisdom, having known which nothing else remains to be known."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among thousands of men, only a few strive for perfection, and among those who strive, only a rare soul truly knows Me in My complete essence.

Verse: "Among thousands of men, one may strive for perfection; even among those who strive, only a few attain Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: My material and spiritual energies pervade all of existence. The material energy consists of earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intellect, and ego.

Verse: "Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence, and false ego�these eight elements are My nature."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Beyond My material energy, O Arjuna, is My superior spiritual energy—the individual souls, who sustain the living beings in this world.

Verse: "Of these, the material nature is My lower nature, while the divine, higher nature is the living entity by which this universe is created."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Know that I am the origin of both material and spiritual worlds. Everything in existence arises from Me alone.

Verse: "Know that all beings have their origin in these two natures, and I am the source of the material and the spiritual worlds."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: There is no truth superior to Me, O Arjuna. Everything rests upon Me as pearls are strung on a thread.

Verse: "There is nothing superior to Me, O mighty-armed Arjuna. All things are strung on Me like pearls on a thread."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, I am the taste of pure water, the light in the sun and moon, the sacred syllable "Om" in the Vedas, and the sound in space.

Verse: "I am the taste in water, the light in the moon and the sun, the syllable Om in the Vedic mantras, and the sound in the ether."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the fragrance of the earth, the brilliance in fire, the life force in all beings, and the austerity in ascetics.

Verse: "I am the ability in man, the brilliance in the fire, the life of all that lives, and the penance of the ascetics."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, I am the eternal seed of all living beings, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the splendor of the glorious.

Verse: "I am the seed of all beings, and I am the intelligence of the intelligent."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among the strong, I am strength devoid of selfish desire. Among all beings, I am desire that aligns with righteousness.

Verse: "I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire. I am the desire of the righteous."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The three modes of nature—goodness, passion, and ignorance—arise from Me. Though they exist in Me, I am beyond them.

Verse: "Know that all states of being�whether of goodness, passion, or ignorance�are manifested by My energy. I am the basis of them all, but I am not within them."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The entire world is deluded by these three modes of nature and fails to recognize Me, the Supreme beyond them.

Verse: "Deluded by the three modes of material nature, the entire world does not know Me, who am above the modes and imperishable."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes, is very difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross it.

Verse: "This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross beyond it."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The ignorant and wicked, deluded by material illusions, do not surrender to Me. They remain trapped by their lower nature.

Verse: "Those who are devoid of faith in Me and who have surrendered to the demoniacal nature, they will not reach Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Four kinds of people worship Me, O Arjuna: the distressed, the seekers of wealth, the inquisitive, and the wise, who know Me as the ultimate truth.

Verse: "Four kinds of virtuous people worship Me: those in distress, those who desire knowledge, those who seek wealth, and those who are wise."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Of these, the wise devotee, who worships Me with knowledge and love, is the most dear to Me, and I am most dear to them.

Verse: "Of these, the wise man, who is endowed with knowledge and is devoted to the supreme truth, is the most dear to Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: All these devotees are noble, but the one who possesses true knowledge of My divine nature is most dear to Me, for they worship Me as their very soul.

Verse: "On account of his complete devotion, I consider him to be the best of all, for he is always absorbed in Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: After many births of seeking, a wise person realizes that I am the ultimate cause of all that exists. Such a great soul is very rare.

Verse: "After many births and deaths, the wise surrender unto Me, realizing that I am everything, and thus they attain the supreme state."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those whose knowledge is stolen by material desires worship demigods, following various rites according to their own nature.

Verse: "Those who are deluded by the three gunas of material nature, who worship various gods, are actually worshiping Me indirectly."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Whatever deity a devotee worships with faith, I make that faith firm so that they may attain their desired results.

Verse: "Whatever form of God a devotee desires to worship with faith, I make that faith steady and unwavering."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: But the benefits attained from worshiping demigods are temporary. Those who worship the gods go to them, but My devotees attain Me.

Verse: "Endowed with that faith, they worship that form and receive from it what they desire. But the ultimate goal is always Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The unintelligent think I have assumed this human form, unaware of My transcendental nature as the Supreme Lord of all creation.

Verse: "Those who are endowed with faith in Me and worship Me exclusively, I grant them the wisdom to attain liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, I am never manifest to the ignorant, for I am covered by My divine energy. The deluded cannot understand Me as the unborn and eternal.

Verse: "Men of small intelligence, who are devoid of understanding, worship the demigods and achieve temporary results."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I know everything about the past, present, and future, but no one truly knows Me in My entirety.

Verse: "I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them, I am covered by My own maya, and so they do not know Me, who am the imperishable and the transcendental."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: All beings are born into illusion, overcome by desires and dualities. They fail to recognize Me as their eternal well-wisher.

Verse: "O Arjuna, I know all beings that have been created in the past, those that are present, and those that are yet to come. But no one knows Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who strive to free themselves from old age and death take refuge in Me, knowing Me as the Supreme Brahman and the essence of all sacrifices.

Verse: "O scion of Bharata, as the Supreme Being, I am the cause of the creation and destruction of the universe. Everything is under My control."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who take shelter in Me, even from lower backgrounds, can attain the highest destination. How much more, then, for righteous brahmanas and devoted kings!

Verse: "Those who are free from the effects of sin and who are virtuous, they are blessed to be devoted to Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Fix your mind on Me, become My devotee, offer your respects to Me, and surely, you will come to Me alone.

Verse: "Those who strive for liberation and who have supreme devotion to Me, are liberated from the material world and attain the eternal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: By knowing Me as the ultimate goal of all sacrifices and the Supreme Lord of all, the wise engage in My service with full devotion.

Verse: "Those who possess the knowledge of the Self and worship Me, are freed from the bonds of material existence and become one with Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who understand My divine nature, both as the ultimate cause and the Supreme Personality, attain Me and are freed from the cycle of birth and death.

Verse: "Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the nature of Brahman? What is the nature of the self? What is the nature of action? And what is the nature of the divine?"
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, what is Brahman? What is karma? What is the nature of this material world? And how do the self-realized attain You at the time of death?

Verse: "Krishna said: The Supreme Brahman is imperishable and beyond all material, transient aspects. It is that which is always present and is beyond all descriptions."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Brahman is the eternal, imperishable reality. The self (Atman) is the individual soul, and karma refers to the actions that cause rebirth in this world.

Verse: "By meditating on the Supreme Brahman, one attains the ultimate truth, and by surrendering to that knowledge, one transcends the cycle of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The physical world is temporary and constantly changing, but My divine energy remains unmanifest and eternal, beyond time and space.

Verse: "Now, I will describe to you the method of attaining the Supreme. Those who remember Me at the time of death, with undistracted minds, attain My divine state."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, at the moment of death, one who remembers Me alone and leaves the body attains My divine abode, without any doubt.

Verse: "Whoever leaves the body, remembering Me with a mind free from doubts, attains to the eternal, supreme, and transcendental world."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Whatever state of mind one remembers at the time of death, that state one attains in the next life due to their constant thoughts.

Verse: "At the time of death, if one thinks of Me with devotion and a pure mind, one will undoubtedly reach My supreme abode."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Therefore, O Arjuna, always remember Me while performing your duty. With a mind absorbed in Me, you will surely come to Me.

Verse: "Those who always meditate on the Supreme Being, without deviating from the path, attain the highest state of liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The Supreme Person is beyond material nature, unchanging, eternal, and self-illuminating. One who understands this transcends the cycle of birth and death.

Verse: "By remembering Me at the time of death, one is free from all material desires and attains liberation, transcending the influence of the gunas (modes of nature)."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who meditate on Me as the Supreme Being, with unwavering devotion and a mind fixed on Me alone, attain Me without fail.

Verse: "With a steady mind, one should remember the Supreme Being at the time of death, focusing their consciousness solely on Him."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The highest destination, My divine abode, is reached by those who understand My supreme nature beyond this temporary world.

Verse: "Those who concentrate their mind on the Supreme and leave the body, their souls, freed from the bonds of material existence, reach the supreme abode."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: At the time of death, one who leaves the body while fixing the life force between the eyebrows and remembering Me attains the Supreme.

Verse: "O son of Kunti, the path that leads to the supreme goal is the path of meditation, wherein the yogi remembers the eternal Brahman with a steady mind."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The great sages who practice meditation on the sacred syllable "Om" and focus on the divine goal attain liberation.

Verse: "Now I will describe the eternal, imperishable path, O Arjuna, which leads the soul to liberation and unity with Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: This world is temporary and full of suffering, but one who reaches My supreme abode never returns to this cycle of birth and death.

Verse: "Those who attain the knowledge of the imperishable, unchanging nature of the supreme soul, transcend death and enjoy eternal bliss."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The material world is subject to repeated creation and dissolution, but My divine realm remains eternal and beyond destruction.

Verse: "By meditating on the ultimate reality, all desires and material attachments are dispelled, leading to liberation from birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who meditate upon Me with an unwavering mind, free from distractions, attain Me effortlessly.

Verse: "Those who are able to leave the body by meditating on the Supreme at the end of their life, their souls enter the supreme spirit."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even great sages return to this world after enjoying heavenly pleasures, but My devotees, having reached Me, never return.

Verse: "O son of Bharata, from the time of birth until the end of one's life, the soul is carried through many forms of existence, ultimately attaining liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, all living beings pass through the cycle of creation and destruction, but those who attain My supreme abode are liberated forever.

Verse: "Those who have knowledge of the eternal, supreme soul are freed from the cycle of birth and death and attain unity with the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: One day of Brahma lasts thousands of ages, and at its end, all beings merge into unmanifest nature, only to be reborn again.

Verse: "At the time of death, the soul leaves the material body and travels according to the consciousness cultivated throughout its life."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The cycle of creation repeats endlessly, but those who take refuge in Me transcend this process and attain liberation.

Verse: "Those who have attained self-realization and meditated on the divine during their lifetime, leave their bodies and attain supreme liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Beyond this temporary world is My eternal, unmanifest realm, which remains untouched by destruction.

Verse: "By meditating on the supreme soul, the yogi reaches a state of union with Me, O Arjuna, and attains eternal bliss."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The supreme destination is My abode, which can only be attained through unwavering devotion and surrender to Me.

Verse: "The path of meditation is the highest of all paths. Those who follow it attain union with Me and transcend the cycles of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, those who attain My divine realm are freed from the cycle of birth and death and experience eternal bliss.

Verse: "By meditating on the Supreme, one transcends all modes of material nature and is freed from the influence of the material world."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The path of light leads to liberation, while the path of darkness leads back to the cycle of birth and death. The wise choose the path of light.

Verse: "At the time of death, those who have practiced meditation on Me with steadfast concentration, attain liberation and reach the supreme state."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Yogis who die during the bright lunar phases and at auspicious times attain liberation, while those who pass away during the dark phases are reborn.

Verse: "O Arjuna, it is said that by remembering Me at the time of death, one reaches the highest state of perfection."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The soul, depending on its spiritual advancement, follows different paths after death. The path of light leads to eternal liberation, while the path of darkness leads back to rebirth.

Verse: "Those who are devoted to meditation, and who leave the body with a mind fixed on Me, reach the transcendental world of the eternal, supreme soul."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: My devotees transcend these two paths, for they fix their minds on Me alone and are not bound by the results of their actions.

Verse: "By meditating on the supreme soul, who is beyond time and space, one attains immortality and eternal bliss."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, through devotion and surrender to Me, one surpasses all karmic reactions and reaches the ultimate goal.

Verse: "Now, listen as I explain to you the path of meditation, which is the most powerful method to attain Me and ultimately reach liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The highest perfection is attained by those who renounce all desires, take refuge in Me, and engage in pure devotion.

Verse: "Those who follow this path of meditation with sincere devotion and understanding, will attain the eternal, supreme abode of the divine."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Understanding this supreme wisdom, O Arjuna, My devotees engage in My service with full faith, knowing that I am the ultimate goal of all existence.

Verse: "Krishna said: I will now explain to you this most profound knowledge, which, when learned, will free you from all the bondage of material existence."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, because you are free from envy, I shall now reveal to you the most confidential wisdom, which will liberate you from all bondage.

Verse: "This knowledge is the most secret of all secrets, and it is the essence of all wisdom. Those who understand it will attain the highest perfection."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: This knowledge is the king of sciences, the purest of all, and it gives direct realization of the truth. It is eternal and practiced joyfully.

Verse: "Those who do not have faith in this teaching and do not follow it, will be deluded and will not reach Me, but will go through the cycle of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who lack faith in this knowledge remain trapped in the cycle of birth and death, failing to attain Me.

Verse: "By My divine power, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are sustained by My energy, but I am not attached to them."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Everything in this universe is pervaded by Me in My unmanifest form. All beings exist within Me, but I am not limited by them.

Verse: "Although I am the creator of all beings, I am not dependent on them. I am beyond the material nature, and I am unaffected by it."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Though all beings dwell within Me, I am not bound by them. My divine energy sustains them, just as the wind is sustained within space.

Verse: "As the all-pervading air moves everywhere in the sky, similarly, I permeate all of creation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, just as mighty winds blow through space but do not bind it, so do all beings exist within Me without affecting My supreme nature.

Verse: "At the end of each cycle of creation, O Arjuna, all beings enter into My nature, and at the beginning of the next cycle, I create them again."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: At the end of each cosmic cycle, all beings merge into My material energy, and at the beginning of a new cycle, I manifest them again.

Verse: "By My divine will, all living beings are created and sustained, and at the end of the cycle, they are absorbed back into My existence."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: By My will, creation unfolds again and again. I send forth all living beings according to their past karmic actions.

Verse: "O Arjuna, those who are attached to the material world and are under the influence of illusion, do not recognize the divine power that governs the creation and destruction of all things."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Though I am the cause of creation, I am not bound by these actions, for I remain detached and beyond the material world.

Verse: "The world is deluded by the three gunas (modes of nature), and they do not understand the eternal and imperishable truth that I am beyond the gunas."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Under My guidance, material nature produces all living beings, O Arjuna. This entire cosmic manifestation functions under My supervision.

Verse: "Fools mock Me when I appear in a human form. They do not know My transcendental nature, and they are deluded by material desires."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The ignorant do not recognize My divine form and consider Me an ordinary being. They fail to understand My transcendental nature.

Verse: "Those who are ignorant of the true nature of the Supreme and who are devoted to the external aspects of the world, are in the grip of the modes of nature."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Such foolish people are deluded by material desires and engage in worthless endeavors, failing to surrender to Me.

Verse: "O Arjuna, great souls who have overcome the influence of the modes of nature, always remain absorbed in Me, knowing that I am the Supreme."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: But great souls, O Arjuna, take refuge in Me alone, knowing Me to be the eternal source of all creation and existence.

Verse: "Those who are free from all material desires and who meditate on Me with devotion and faith, are able to perceive My divine form."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: With unwavering devotion, they glorify Me, always absorbed in My thoughts and engaged in My service with determination.

Verse: "Others worship various forms of God with devotion, offering sacrifices and performing rituals, yet they ultimately come to Me, because all paths lead to Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Some worship Me through knowledge, others through meditation, and some through sacrifices, seeing Me in various divine forms.

Verse: "I am the fire of sacrifice, the holy syllable Om, the Vedas, the sacrifice, the offerings, the sacred thread, the fire, and the offering to the ancestors."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the ritual, the sacrifice, the offering, the sacred syllable Om, and I am the fire into which the offering is made.

Verse: "I am the father of this universe, the mother, the supporter, and the grandfather. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, and the syllable Om."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the father, mother, and sustainer of all beings. I am the purifier, the sacred sound, and the essence of the Vedas.

Verse: "I am the goal, the sustainer, the lord, the witness, the refuge, the friend, and the origin and the end of all creation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, and the witness. I am the abode, the refuge, and the dearest friend of all beings.

Verse: "I am the heat in the sun, the water in the ocean, the strength of the strong, and the wisdom of the wise."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I give heat, I send forth rain, and I withhold it. I am both immortality and death, being and non-being.

Verse: "I am the power that sustains the universe, the knowledge in all beings, the wealth of the wealthy, and the eternal truth."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who perform Vedic rituals, desiring heavenly pleasures, attain the celestial realms, enjoying divine luxuries earned by their merits.

Verse: "Those who know the knowledge of the self and meditate on Me with firm devotion, realize that I am the ultimate goal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: But when their merits are exhausted, they return to the mortal world. Thus, those who seek temporary pleasures remain trapped in the cycle of birth and death.

Verse: "By meditating on Me with full devotion, they achieve liberation from the cycle of birth and death and attain the eternal supreme abode."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who worship Me with exclusive devotion, thinking of Me alone, I personally provide for their needs and protect them.

Verse: "Even those who worship other gods with faith, they are ultimately worshiping Me, though in a less direct manner."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even those who worship other deities, with faith, in reality, worship Me alone, though they do so improperly.

Verse: "Whatever form of god a devotee desires to worship with faith, I make that faith unshakable, and I bless them according to their devotion."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: As the supreme enjoyer of all sacrifices, I am the Lord of all worship. But those who do not recognize Me remain bound by karma.

Verse: "Those who worship the gods attain the divine realms, but those who worship Me attain the ultimate, imperishable realm."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Those who worship the gods go to the gods, those who worship ancestors go to them, and My devotees come to Me alone.

Verse: "Whoever offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water, I accept it from them, for it is the sincerity of the devotion that matters."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: If one offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water, I accept that loving offering from a pure heart.

Verse: "Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give, and whatever you perform as penance, do it as an offering to Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever sacrifices you make, do it as an offering to Me, O Arjuna.

Verse: "By doing this, you will be freed from the bondage of karma, and your actions will purify your mind and soul."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: By dedicating all your actions to Me, you will be freed from the bondage of karma and attain liberation.

Verse: "I am equal to all beings, but those who worship Me with devotion are dear to Me, and I am dear to them."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am equal to all beings, but those who worship Me with devotion are in Me, and I am in them.

Verse: "Even if a person commits the most heinous sins, if they are devoted to Me with a pure heart, they can cross over all the obstacles and attain the highest goal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even if a devotee has committed great sins, if they surrender to Me wholeheartedly, they must be considered saintly because their determination is fixed on the right path.

Verse: "Those who are devoted to Me and who sincerely seek refuge in Me, I protect them from all dangers and guide them to liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Such a person quickly becomes virtuous and attains lasting peace. O Arjuna, declare boldly that My devotee never perishes.

Verse: "Arjuna, the divine is equally accessible to all beings, irrespective of their caste, creed, or social status, for they are all my children."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Even those born in unfavorable circumstances—women, merchants, or laborers—if they take refuge in Me, can attain the supreme destination.

Verse: "Those who are free from attachment, who do not discriminate between others, and who are devoted to Me, are the ones who reach the highest goal."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: How much more, then, for the virtuous brahmanas and royal sages! Therefore, O Arjuna, engage in My devotion wholeheartedly.

Verse: "Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, and you will reach Me, for I am the ultimate goal of all beings."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Always think of Me, worship Me, bow down to Me, and you will surely come to Me. I promise you this because you are dear to Me.

Verse: "Krishna said: Listen again, O mighty-armed Arjuna, to My supreme words, which I shall impart to you, for your benefit."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, listen again to My supreme teachings. Because you are dear to Me, I will reveal profound knowledge that will benefit you greatly.

Verse: "Neither the gods nor the great sages know My origin, for I am the source of all the gods and sages."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Neither the celestial beings nor the great sages fully understand My origin, for I am the source of both gods and sages.

Verse: "He who knows Me as the unborn, the beginningless, the supreme Lord of all the worlds, he is not deluded by the illusion of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: One who truly understands Me as the unborn, eternal, and supreme Lord of all creation is freed from all sins.

Verse: "Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from doubt, forgiveness, truthfulness, self-control, calmness, purity, freedom from envy, and equanimity�these are My divine qualities."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Intelligence, wisdom, non-delusion, patience, truthfulness, control of the senses, and peace of mind—all arise from Me.

Verse: "Those who possess these qualities are born of My divine nature and attain liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Fearlessness, purity, charity, self-restraint, sacrifice, study of scriptures, and humility are all qualities originating from Me.

Verse: "Those who are free from pride and delusion, who are devoted to Me, and who surrender to Me with a pure heart, they know Me in reality."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: The seven great sages, the four original ancestors, and the divine Manus were born from My mind and are the progenitors of all beings.

Verse: "Those who possess knowledge of the three gunas (modes of nature), and who know the ultimate purpose of life, reach the eternal realm of liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: One who understands My divine opulences and creative power develops unwavering devotion and faith in Me.

Verse: "I am the source of all material and spiritual worlds. Everything emanates from Me. The wise who know this, worship Me with devotion."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the source of all creation. Everything originates from Me. The wise, knowing this, worship Me with devotion.

Verse: "With their minds absorbed in Me, and their hearts full of devotion, they engage in loving service to Me, and I grant them the highest wisdom."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: My devotees always discuss My glories, delight in My presence, and remain ever absorbed in Me.

Verse: "To those who are constantly devoted and who meditate upon Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: To those who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can attain Me.

Verse: "Out of compassion for them, I, who am seated in their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the light of wisdom."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Out of compassion, I dwell in their hearts and illuminate them with divine knowledge, dispelling the darkness of ignorance.

Verse: "Arjuna said: O Krishna, You have spoken to me of this supreme secret of knowledge and wisdom, and I now realize that You are the Supreme Divine Being."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Supreme Lord, You are the ultimate truth, the origin of all creation, and the eternal divine being. The sages confirm this, and now I understand it as well.

Verse: "You are the supreme reality, the ultimate truth, and the absolute knowledge. You are the eternal, imperishable, and transcendental existence."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: The great sages like Narada, Asita, and Vyasa have proclaimed Your divine glories, and You Yourself have declared the same.

Verse: "Now I have understood Your true nature, O Krishna, and I surrender to You completely, asking You to enlighten me further."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, I accept all that You have said as the absolute truth. Neither the gods nor the demons can comprehend Your greatness.

Verse: "Please tell me more, for my doubt is dispelled, and I have full faith in Your words."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Supreme Being, You alone know Yourself. You are the Creator and Lord of all beings, the source of the entire universe.

Verse: "Krishna said: I will now explain to you the divine manifestations of My glories, O Arjuna, which are in reality the expressions of My infinite power."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: Please describe to me Your divine manifestations so that I may understand how You pervade all existence.

Verse: "Listen to this, for by knowing these glories, one can attain liberation and be free from the bondage of birth and death."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Supreme Lord, how should I meditate upon You? In what forms should I contemplate Your divine presence?

Verse: "I am the Self within all living beings. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all creation."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Janardana, tell me in detail of Your limitless glories, which pervade all realms and aspects of existence.

Verse: "I am the light in the sun, the moon, and the fire. I am the taste in water, the sacred syllable Om in the Vedas, and the sound in space."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, I shall now describe My divine manifestations, but My glories are limitless and beyond complete comprehension.

Verse: "I am the ability in man, the brilliance in fire, the life in all beings, and the penance of the ascetics."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the Self residing in the hearts of all beings, and I am the beginning, middle, and end of all existence.

Verse: "I am the original fragrance of the earth, the heat in fire, the vitality in all beings, and the life-giving energy in the plants and trees."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among luminaries, I am the radiant Sun; among the Maruts, I am Marichi; and among stars, I am the Moon.

Verse: "I am the seed of all creation, the creator of the universe, and the sustainer of all beings. I am the origin and the dissolution of the universe."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among the gods, I am Indra; among senses, I am the mind; and among living beings, I am consciousness.

Verse: "I am the eternal time, the unmanifested, and the source of all that is manifest. I am the ultimate goal of all paths."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among the Rudras, I am Shiva; among the Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am Kubera; among Vasus, I am Agni; and among mountains, I am Meru.

Verse: "I am the support of the entire universe, the source of all knowledge, the ultimate objective of meditation, and the supreme goal of all living beings."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among priests, I am Brihaspati; among commanders, I am Kartikeya; and among water bodies, I am the ocean.

Verse: "I am the Vedic mantras, the knowledge of the Self, and the ultimate truth that transcends all worldly experiences."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among great sages, I am Bhrigu; among words, I am Om; among sacrifices, I am Japa (silent meditation); and among immovable things, I am the Himalayas.

Verse: "I am the eternal law of righteousness, and I am the protector of those who are devoted to Me, granting them protection from all dangers."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among trees, I am the Banyan tree; among celestial sages, I am Narada; among Gandharvas, I am Chitraratha; and among perfected beings, I am Kapila.

Verse: "I am the strength of the strong, the purity of the pure, the passion in the heart, and the self-control of the disciplined."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among horses, I am Ucchaishravas, born of nectar; among mighty elephants, I am Airavata; and among men, I am the king.

Verse: "I am the faith in the hearts of the faithful, the penance of the ascetics, the devotion of the devotees, and the righteousness of the righteous."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among weapons, I am the Vajra (thunderbolt); among cows, I am Kamadhenu; among serpents, I am Vasuki; and among Nagas, I am Ananta.

Verse: "I am the sacrifice in the Vedas, the offering in fire, the sustaining food, and the strength of the strong."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among water beings, I am Varuna; among the departed ancestors, I am Aryama; and among law enforcers, I am Yama, the lord of death.

Verse: "I am the mind of the yogi, the intellect of the wise, and the wisdom of those who are free from ignorance."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among demons, I am Prahlada; among subduers, I am time; among animals, I am the lion; and among birds, I am Garuda.

Verse: "I am the great and glorious form of all creation, beyond all dualities, and I am the eternal witness to the actions of all beings."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among purifiers, I am the wind; among warriors, I am Lord Rama; among water creatures, I am the Makara (crocodile); and among rivers, I am the Ganga.

Verse: "I am the destruction of the wicked, the protection of the righteous, and the salvation of those who seek liberation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, among all creations, I am the beginning, the middle, and the end. Among all sciences, I am the knowledge of the self.

Verse: "Among the powers of nature, I am the most powerful. Among the animals, I am the lion, and among the birds, I am the eagle."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among letters, I am the first letter (A); among compound words, I am the dual compound; I am the infinite time and the sustainer of all creation.

Verse: "Among the rivers, I am the Ganges. Among the mountains, I am Mount Meru, the king of all mountains."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the all-devouring death and the generator of future beings. Among feminine qualities, I am fame, beauty, speech, memory, intelligence, patience, and forgiveness.

Verse: "Among the trees, I am the banyan tree, and among the sages, I am the sage Vasistha."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among hymns, I am the Brihat-Sama; among poetic meters, I am the Gayatri; among months, I am Margashirsha; and among seasons, I am spring.

Verse: "Among the weapons, I am the thunderbolt, and among the cows, I am the wish-fulfilling cow."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among deceivers, I am the gambling spirit; among the powerful, I am strength; among the victorious, I am perseverance; and among the virtuous, I am virtue itself.

Verse: "Among the serpents, I am Vasuki, and among the fish, I am the whale."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among the Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva (Krishna); among the Pandavas, I am Arjuna; among sages, I am Vyasa; and among poets, I am Ushana.

Verse: "Among the purifiers, I am the wind, and among the warriors, I am Rama, the hero of the Ramayana."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Among punishments, I am the rod of chastisement; among seekers of victory, I am policy; among secrets, I am silence; and among the wise, I am wisdom.

Verse: "Among the rivers, I am the Yamuna, and among the mountains, I am the Himalayas."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am the seed of all existence, O Arjuna. There is no being—moving or unmoving—that can exist without Me.

Verse: "I am the great and mighty fire, and among the oceans, I am the ocean of milk."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: My divine manifestations are endless. Whatever is glorious, beautiful, or powerful in this world springs from My splendor.

Verse: "I am the sun and the moon, the eternal and the unchanging. I am the energy behind all creation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Just understand, O Arjuna, that all wonderful, majestic, and powerful things arise from but a spark of My infinite glory.

Verse: "With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade the entire universe and remain unattached, yet I am the essence of all creation."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: But why do you need to know all this in detail? With a mere fragment of My divine power, I pervade and sustain the entire universe.

Verse: "Arjuna said: O Krishna, I have heard from You in detail about the creation and dissolution of the universe, and Your divine manifestations. Yet, I still desire to see Your universal form."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, out of compassion, You have revealed the supreme mystery of the self and the nature of existence. My illusion is now dispelled, and my heart is clear. But I desire to see Your divine cosmic form in all its glory.

Verse: "O Krishna, You are the Supreme Being, the highest of all. Please show me Your divine, universal form, to help me understand the true nature of Your power."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: I have heard from You about Your infinite glories, how You pervade all creation, and how You are the origin and sustainer of the universe. Yet, O Supreme Lord, I wish to witness this truth directly.

Verse: "Krishna said: O Arjuna, behold My divine form, which is beyond the perception of the senses. With the divine vision granted by Me, you will see My universal form."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: If You think I am capable of seeing Your divine form, then please, O Lord of all beings, reveal to me Your universal manifestation. Let me witness Your supreme, infinite power as it truly is.

Verse: "Behold, O Arjuna, My hundreds and thousands of divine forms, of various colors and shapes, displaying numerous wonders in this vast universe."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, behold My divine cosmic form! See the countless gods, the sages, and the vast, infinite manifestations of My being, all contained within Me. You shall witness the wonders of the universe in a single vision.

Verse: "Here you can see the gods and sages, the great rishis, and all the beings in the universe, as they are all present in My form."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Behold the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Ashvins, and the Maruts! See the countless divine forms, beyond human comprehension, manifested in My cosmic form.

Verse: "Behold, O Arjuna, all the beings that exist in the past, present, and future. You can now see them, for all are contained within Me."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: O Arjuna, within My body, you shall see many marvelous things—unseen before! Behold the entire universe, moving and unmoving, contained within Me, unified as one divine form.

Verse: "Here you can see the many faces and arms, the brilliant radiance of My universal form, and the countless divine manifestations."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: But you cannot see this form with your ordinary eyes. Therefore, O Arjuna, I grant you divine vision. Behold My infinite, cosmic manifestation!

Verse: "You cannot see Me with your physical eyes, but I give you divine sight. With this sight, behold My supreme form, which pervades the entire universe."
Verse_Meaning: Sanjaya to Dhritarashtra: Saying this, Krishna displayed His universal form to Arjuna, revealing countless faces, infinite divine weapons, and wondrous celestial adornments, illuminating all directions.

Verse: "All the warriors of both sides, including Bhishma, Drona, and Karna, are being destroyed by My divine will. None can escape My power."
Verse_Meaning: Sanjaya to Dhritarashtra: The universal form was radiant like a thousand suns rising at once, blindingly brilliant. It extended beyond all limits, filling the sky and space with its immeasurable splendor.

Verse: "O Arjuna, as you observe the destruction of all these warriors, know that they have already been doomed by My will. You are merely an instrument in the grand plan."
Verse_Meaning: Sanjaya to Dhritarashtra: Arjuna saw the entire cosmos within Krishna’s infinite body—all gods, celestial beings, and entire realms of existence, displayed in divine harmony within Him.

Verse: "Behold the Kaurava army, which is on the verge of destruction. You can see their heads, their bodies, and their limbs falling in the battlefield, as all are being absorbed by My form."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Lord, I see within You the forms of all deities and beings. You are boundless, infinite in strength and radiance, shining in all directions like blazing fire and the sun combined.

Verse: "Arjuna, I am the Time that devours everything. I have already consumed all the great warriors. They are merely moving forward to their death."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: Your form is difficult to comprehend, O Krishna! It is immense, limitless, and adorned with numerous faces, hands, and divine weapons. Your sight overwhelms me completely.

Verse: "All the great warriors are already dead. You are only the instrument, O Arjuna. Do not be disturbed by what you see. It is inevitable."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: I see You with a crown, a mace, and a shining discus. Your brilliance is boundless, spreading everywhere, like a raging fire consuming the universe.

Verse: "Bhishma, Drona, Karna, and many other famous heroes have already been destroyed by My will. They will not be able to withstand the inevitable end."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Lord, seeing Your immense form that pervades the heavens, the earth, and all directions, my mind trembles in fear, and I find no peace.

Verse: "All the warriors in this battle, both the Kauravas and the Pandavas, will soon be consumed by My divine power. I am the ultimate cause of their destruction."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: All celestial beings seek refuge in You. Some praise You in awe, while others tremble in fear, watching Your infinite form spread across the cosmos.

Verse: "O Arjuna, you are the witness to this grand spectacle. The time has come for the destruction of the warriors, and it cannot be averted."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: I see the Rudras, the Adityas, the Vasus, and the celestial sages within You. I see You with countless eyes, mouths, arms, and terrifying fangs, devouring all directions.

Verse: "Now, I see your divine form with a thousand faces, arms, and eyes, adorned with all divine ornaments. The sight is overwhelming and astonishing."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: The brilliance of Your form surpasses anything I have ever seen! O Supreme Lord, Your boundless glory fills my heart with both devotion and fear.

Verse: "O Krishna, I now see You as the Supreme Being, who is the beginning and the end of all creation. You are the eternal, imperishable reality, beyond time and space."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: Seeing Your terrifying fangs and blazing eyes, I lose all sense of self. I feel my strength fade away, and I can barely stand before You.

Verse: "You are the creator, the preserver, and the destroyer of the universe. You are beyond all dualities and transcend both the material and the spiritual worlds."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Lord, the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with their allies and warriors, are rushing into Your enormous mouth! Some are crushed between Your teeth, their fates sealed.

Verse: "I see You as the supreme ruler of the universe, the cause of creation and destruction. You are beyond the understanding of all the gods and sages."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: Just as rivers flow swiftly into the ocean, so too do these warriors rush into Your blazing mouth, where they meet their inevitable destruction.

Verse: "Everything in the universe exists within You. You are the embodiment of the supreme consciousness, the eternal, undivided, and all-pervading reality."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: As moths rush into a flame, seeking their own demise, so too do these kings and warriors enter Your fiery jaws, perishing by Your divine will.

Verse: "Your vision reveals a form that is beyond the limitations of time and space. The entire universe is contained within Your being, which is eternal and ever-changing."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Krishna, Your all-consuming form devours everything! Who are You, O Supreme Being? What is Your true nature? Tell me, O Lord of the Universe!

Verse: "O Krishna, I now understand that You are beyond all understanding and that You alone are the ultimate cause of the creation and destruction of the universe."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: I am Time, the great destroyer of all worlds. I have come to annihilate all these warriors. Even without you, they shall perish; victory is already decided.

Verse: "O Krishna, Your form is inconceivable and beyond comprehension. I bow to You, the supreme Lord, who is beyond all dualities."
Verse_Meaning: Krishna to Arjuna: Arise, O Arjuna! Become My instrument in this battle. Slay your enemies, for they are already doomed by My divine decree. Seize your destiny and fight!

Verse: "Your body is radiant and vast, like the cosmos itself. You are the eternal witness to all creation, and You are the ultimate source of all existence."
Verse_Meaning: Sanjaya to Dhritarashtra: Hearing Krishna’s words, Arjuna, trembling in awe, bowed down before Him and, with folded hands, spoke in reverence and surrender.

Verse: "O Krishna, I see You in the form of all the gods, sages, and celestial beings. You are the source of all the virtues, powers, and attributes of the universe."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: O Lord, You are the eternal refuge, the imperishable Supreme Being. You are the knower of all things, the ultimate goal, the unchanging reality beyond comprehension.

Verse: "O Krishna, Your universal form contains all the beings that exist in the world. I see the entire creation, including the living and the non-living, absorbed within You."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: You are the beginning, the middle, and the end of all existence. You are the Supreme refuge of all beings, and You pervade everything as the infinite cosmic spirit.

Verse: "All the great warriors in this battle, including Bhishma and Drona, are being consumed by Your divine power. They are helpless before Your universal form."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: You are the Lord of all deities, the primal cause of the universe, the sustainer of all. O Krishna, You alone are the eternal truth that transcends creation.

Verse: "O Krishna, I see that You are beyond the scope of both time and space. You are the ultimate cause of both creation and destruction in the universe."
Verse_Meaning: Arjuna to Krishna: I bow down before You in infinite reverence! O Supreme Being, forgive my faults, whether committed knowingly or unknowingly, in ignorance or devotion.
